title: Pull request to update README on original branch
TODO list to keep track of some needed things
Grammatical correction for remaining enemies label
bodyText:
Noticed that when the remaining enemy count comes down to 1, the word 'enemies' persists on the label, so i corrected that to show 'enemy' or 'enemies' instead, depending on the remaining enemy count. I also put 'left' after it to sort of bring back the more proper-sounding 'remaning' from back then, but it's shorter now to save space.
Used to be:
'3 ENEMIES'
'2 ENEMIES'
'1 ENEMIES' <doesn't sound right doesn't it?
Now:
'3 ENEMIES LEFT'
'2 ENEMIES LEFT'
'1 ENEMY LEFT' <sounds quite about right, and I even brought back the 'remaining' but shorter.
That's about it, and for a fact I'm really new to Java and am actively practicing it, using examples from yours' and other's code. It gets less complicated the more i look into it. :)
also first two dialogue/localization JSON coming soon

bodyText:

Make liquid tiles the color of their fluid.

title: Omnidrill will report unproductive base surface
bodyText: In contrast with one-resource drill, the omnidrill is not reporting it has been placed on unproductive base surface (i.e. water, grass, sand, lava etc.). This change fixes this issue.

title: Introduce workaround for libgdx issue by @codegist
bodyText:
libgdx has a buggy piece of code which introduces crashes into some devices. This happens in some devices as commented in libgdx/libgdx#4626.
Basically if the game is in foreground and you lock the screen the application gets killed by libgdx AndroidGraphics when resuming.
AndroidGraphics: waiting for pause synchronization took too long; assuming deadlock and killing

Luckily @codegist discussed a workaround in libgdx/libgdx#3861. This pull request adds the workaround to Mindustry.

title: Added descriptions for all unlockables which didn't have them
bodyText:
The descriptions were created by a mix of taking a look at v3.5, experimenting in sandbox and inspecting code.
Let me know when I'm supposed to rework anything. Turrets should probably be described more precisely, but I'll need help with that.
If you are satisfied with the descriptions, let me know in a comment so I can prepare the translation files and add them to this pull request. (I started the pull request early so you can comment on lines etc.)
Also let me know if I should create a new pull request with the changes in a single commit. For now, I've checked in most logical groups separately so they could be reverted or cherry-picked.

title: Adjustable core position
bodyText:
Refactored the previous pull request so it uses ints in the public interface. I opened a new pull request since I messed up the old branch. To sum it up again:

Wave missions spawn the core in the center of the map by default
Battle missions spawn the core at (50|50) by default
Both mentioned mission types allow configuring a custom location.
The tutorial sector spawns the core at (60|60) again like in previous versions (but is still disabled)

title: Fixes bug which let phase conveyor operate with any non-zero power; now requires full power to work
bodyText:
AnnaLaura reported this bug a few weeks ago.
Instead of making it binary, we could degrade the throughput by scaling the transport by the satisfaction, but this is the easiest fix.
I noticed that Phased Conduit has the same problem, but the code looks like it does scale by satisfaction.  However, I can't measure any perf difference betwen a barely-powered and fully powered liquid bridge, so I'm not sure how the code works.

title: Power Lasers Transparency
bodyText:
Sometimes power lasers look too bright and cover too much area (especially when they are clustered) and I've been missing a functionality that would allow to change that. So I implemented it.
It required some changes in block rendering (and scheduling blocks to render) code so that each visible laser is rendered only once. This particular change optimizes draws and increases FPS.
The opacity can by change in the Settings->Graphics->Power Laser Opacity.
I'v also slightly reduced lasers width.
How it looks like with different transparency values:

title: 🚧 Add insulator wall
bodyText:
problem
(especially when) playing on servers you might want to keep certain power grids(/graphs) separate from one another for a multitude of reasons:

a mass driver chain with its own power supply
ditto for phase conveyors
keeping the production & defense grids separate
have self sufficient thorium & titanium mines for a power plant that powers the rest
preventing vital systems going down by accidentally connecting them to other grids
etc

on single player its still "somewhat easy" to oversee, but on multiplayer not everyone shares your grey matter so they wouldn't be fully aware of grid intentions unless e.g. message boards are placed everywhere.
brainstorms
on my road to a solution i stumbled upon several ideas:


a "sorter" block that could be connected to a grid that colorized their wires for a visual difference, but then what if one or more graphs get forcibly merged via e.g. a solar panel placed between them? would the colors somehow merge? how would the gui look to set colors? etc?


a setting on the powerpoles somehow that prevented all automatic connections, but that shares the same issues as the above, moreover: how would players on a server find out where the power sorting blocks and/or configurable powerpoles are located? would be confusing if for some visually unknown reason a wire would not (want to) connect.


a wall block that blocks "all" wires from going over, but then it would be weird to have awkwardly shaped gaps in the wall just for wires to pass through, and you'd also have to have logic in place that would check for all wires above a wall once placed, overall a technical nightmare.


so eventually i've settled for a wall that simply blocks automatic connections from going over them, players can still connect them manually, this allows for a subsystem to be completely walled without gaps, and power is also easy to extract, and as a bonus it communicates to other players that the separate grid is intentional, instead of others mistaking it for a bug and "fixing" it by proudly connecting it to the grid and calling it a day.


considerations

a 1x1 insulator block would be more than enough, the 2x2 insulator would probably not be used (a lot), but walls come in even numbers so i've added it for that reason.
texture is the titanium wall saturated down to greyscale. (hence why its declaration in the files is right below titanium)
i've tried to mimic the recent commits where new blocks got added, not sure if this is the exact method you would have used, but thats why its called a prototype :)
as of writing this i noticed that it only applies to placed power poles, placing other things would still cause the powerpoles from "inside" the wall the connect over them to said machinery, will probably send a commit to solve that soon.
for the costs i went with silicon and glass, since those are common things to use in (high voltage) insulators, this commit also includes a tech tree entry where i've placed them behind the kiln, since it felt more fitting there than in the wall section, but feel free to change that.

visuals

(static)

(phase conveyors with their own power supply)

(just imagine the conveyor going to a very important power plant for very important stuff, you wouldn't want to accidentally drain the self sufficient grid for the miner)

(connects as normal if there is a gap in the wall)

(ugly setup illustrating that manual connections still work)
🍠

title: 🗜 Pressure conduit
bodyText:
When transporting liquids over long distances the pressure/fullness/quantity/etc tends to suffer, this is my attempt to add a conduit that can output at a slightly higher  〃 than its input side.
While it technically may not change a lot (a high to low flow won't ruin or blow up stuff) it would be visually pleasing to be able to get a large quantity of liquids to a location and pressurize it somehow (that does not involve filling the entire path to 100% capacity) to get that sweet sweet fluid glow going.
I had originally considered that it would need power (trivia at bottom), i instead went for a high tech material, surge alloy in this case, to be the explanation for why it works without power, open to suggestions regarding this.
The below example setup is a bit crude, but it illustrates how that over longer distances chained pressure conduits the "bonus" adds up, and it can "suck" lower 〃 conduits dry, one could view it as a reverse overflow gate, since it can pressurize specific parts of a pipe network first.
(though they don't need to be chained back to back, as long as they are somewhere in a flow path their bonuses add up, the pressure they output can be seen as a "checkpoint")

(my initial attempts consisted of a liquid tank / machine hybrid with compression animations and what not, but that hit a few roadblocks along the way, so i tried a new conduit type instead 😗)

title: 🔩 Add (plastanium) diode
bodyText:
A possible implementation for this suggestion by @constatinus (and many others)
functionality
This pull adds an insulated diode block, that (currently) forwards power (50% of the difference) from one battery to another if the power within from is greater than the to battery, a large battery can fully fill both small and large batteries, but small batteries will only fill large batteries to 4k.
example 1
Below is an example of an impact reactor that will not shut down if the "outside network"'s power turns negative, since the battery inside the walls will only store/transmit "excess" energy, thus it will always have just enough power to stay running, but it will export all that it won't need.

example 2
Below is an example of high energy usage machines/parts of your base that you would only want to run if there is enough spare power for it.

thoughts

i went with the plastanium border color to signify its insulated property, which fits nice with the existing power insulation walls, to signify & prevent accidental connections through a possibly one wide gap.
base texture was a solar panel, which is overlayn by what most would consider a diode icon.
recipe is a mix between solar panels and plastanium walls, since its both electric but also insulates.
not sure if i used entity.sleep() correctly here, it would make some sense to not constantly check for batteries until a proximity update has been found.
my intention is to add a functionality to "inject" into the other power graph somehow, thoughts on that are pending.
it extends Block since that was the first place i found that had rotation support, though it should probably be moved to a power block type.
went with interacting between batteries since i wasn't sure if/how a block could support being part of two graphs, and battery blocks happen to store power, so this simple thing just facilitates moving power from one battery to another, not caring which graph any is connected to.

🥔

title: 🐬 Factorio flavoured powerlines
bodyText:
annoyance
When trying to move & place powerpoles over long distances it often turns out roughly like this, inefficient and duplicate nodes:

proposed
This draft overrides drag-placing powernodes (since who needs those back to back anyways?) by not placing those middlemen.
By default it places them in a straight line, but they will use the convejor pathfinding when said key is held down.
It will not take existing powernodes on the map into account, thus the lines may interconnect in a strange way, though the beginning and end are guaranteed still connect one way or another.

caveats

doesn't check if a large powerpole can fit in a found 1x1 tile
doesn't suggest a new location if the found one is entirely obstructed
doesn't pathfind the shortest route over the terain
probably more, but hey, its a draft :)

title: Power productivity & Drone pad standby
bodyText:
This pull request introduces two chances:

power productivity, consumers can now (unlike before) increase/decrease their power realtime.
drone pad standby, consumes no power while not in use.

Since drones are autonomous once launched it would not make sense to lower their move/mine/attack speed based on the condition their pad is in, and the pad is literally & visually not doing anything while the drones are maxed, so it would make sense for them to use no power during.
Possible balance changes:

increase base power usage of all drone pads, to compensate the long run.
make standby drone pads use a fraction of the power while on standby.

This pull is mainly to prevent the constant (dis)connecting of (mainly miner) drones to save a few grains of power, which seems like a chore to have to babysit them until they grow up. (or die)
edit: found a related feathub entry.

title: Fix key hints to display friendly names instead of internal names
bodyText:
Core.keybinds.get(Binding).key.name() gives the enum name instead of the user-friendly name. This becomes a problem when the player binds controls to keys like "L-Shift", "[", "1", etc. which will display as "SHIFT_LEFT", "LEFT_BRACKET", "NUM_1", etc.
Using toString() instead fixes it, but I'm not sure if this is the correct fix, as KeybindDialog.java does it differently.

title: Adding the feature to switch doors using a logic controller
bodyText:
Compiled and tested



the Player and the controller can equal access to the door switch.




the controller has the same click delay as the player.




if controller reversed the signal on positive - the door will is open, if reversed on empty the door closes.




the Controller also switches the door provided that its signal has changed (if the controller signal does not change and the player switches the door, then the 3 point is ignored until the controller signal changes)




If there is a situation that the door did not have time to switch because of the delay and the signal does not comply with the rule of paragraph 3 AND the player does not switch the door manually, the door will change its state to the correct one after the delay.



> A short video showing the principle of operation < (YouTube)

title: [conveyor] plastanium
bodyText:
prototype, posting in this state since people seem genuinely interested, so open sourcing it :)

Adds a plastanium conveyor with a high(er) throughput than its counterparts, items on it get transported by roomba-like craters.
(for more info check the discord's #development around/before the time of posting this pull)

code: unstable, messy, plenty of bugs, hacky & edge cases
sprite: cute as hell
balanced: barely
foo: bar

(i have tried higher throughput conveyors before but i ran into the conveyor code wall, and by random luck the train thingy i made recently sparked the idea of moving items on conveyors via entities, bypassing said code entirely, though this is arguably quite heavy because of the increased entity count, while it lacks tons of features, its a nice draft to showcase & gather feedback)

title: Set primitive wrapping to false for scripts
bodyText: Rhino usually converts Java primitives to their JS equivalents. However, Rhino actually converts their boxed equivalents (Boolean for boolean, Integer for int, etc.) into JavaObjects. These JavaObjects aren't allowed in ClassAccess.java, which is another thing. For now, this PR sets primitive wrapping to false, which converts their boxed values into the primitive equivalents, so that Boolean gets converted to a JS boolean and is usable.

title: Improved ItemModule::take() behavior
bodyText:
The original take() behavior spams items in whatever order they appear in the items list until each index is depleted, which is problematic when non-specific unloaders are competing against dedicated unloaders for a low-index resources.
My modification makes the take() loop persistent so take() will do complete laps around the item list starting from wherever the previous call returned from, never repeating the same item twice in a row unless there is nothing else to return. A significant improvement IMO.
How is this an improvement? With the original behavior, if you converge a bunch of belts on a storage block or launcher, want to unload a few belts of specific resources (ex.: copper, lead, silicon and titanium for surge alloy) and pass everything else including overflows along using non-specific unloaders, you are out of luck when the resources you want are at the top of the list since most of those will get swept away by non-specific unloaders. With the rotating take(), non-specific unloaders are equal-opportunity across all available resources, which gives single-resource unloaders that many more chances to unload more of their resources before non-specific unloaders get to them. It also reduces the rate at which items further down the list that may hardly ever get touched by the existing implementation will race toward the storage block's cap. The even drain across all items will help prevent things like mass driver stalls due to receivers filling up with an excess resource that isn't getting cleared.
It would be even nicer if dedicated unloaders had priority over non-specific ones (non-specific unloaders don't touch resources with dedicated unloaders unless the dedicated unloaders are overflowing), though that would require a rework beyond my current "getting the stupid IDE and tool chains to work" level of familiarity with Java development.
To sum it up: trivial change, big impact for people who like mixing belts and sorting them out with unloaders.

bodyText:
nydus server submission //\(oo)/\\


using a non default port to allow rewiring which server it point to on my end:

the reasoning behind this is to be able to switch the port away from the main server in the event that i'm testing a (minigame) plugin that needs a bunch of players, so i can leach of the nydus entry in the global server list.
i intend to keep a close eye on the stream of (new) players that join through this new listing, i already have a small fleet of admins (which i intend to grow more over time), as well as developing new(er) antigrief measures as reaction(s) to what happens on this server substrate.
furthermore i was curious about the "legality" of being allowed to turn off the port under certain circumstances (huge influx of griefers / filled to capacity / etc), since the SERVERLIST.md does not mention requiring a 24/7 uptime sla, so i am curious on your standpoint on it.
also, the player limit (as can be seen above) is currently 11, which is not "entirely" true:

(there's a "secret" double cap in place, so players who aren't scared of the player cap being full can still get in if they want to, this change grandfathers the change that admins can always join)
of course i plan to adjust the player limit over time based on the influx of new players if this pull gets accepted.
that's about it, thanks for reading, let me know if you (or anyone) has questions :) 🥔

oh, and with modified jar i mean that i have some server sided enhancements in place to slightly modify the experience, while staying within the constraints what the server can pull off without players requiring custom clients and/or mods.

title: [quality of life] resuming construction in bulk
bodyText:
Currently when you run out of building resources (or when you die) half way through construction you're left with one or more build blocks with barely any progress, and the only way to complete what was intended is to either click all of them by hand, or delete them in order to replace them.
This draft allows people to resume the build by allowing it to be added to the build queue if the block being constructed matches the current type.
Some things that are up for debate:

it only allows the original block to be constructed, no wall/conveyor/drill hotswap upgrading.
it keeps the rotation the original block was in, could either be annoying or fairly useful.
and of course the code, no idea if i thought of everything, haven't tested it a lot yet.



gif shows me running out, then scavenging copper to resume via dragging a new line 🥔

For a solution i propose to show the name of the two conflicting maps to allow for easier finding:

title: Remove kr server
bodyText:
Too many griefers
Players didn't want to grief on their main server, so the users seemed to be doing it on my server.
Admins are volunteers.
The plugin solves most of the problems, but on average 7 hours a day, about 13 people come to griefing the server every day.
Yeah. Mindustry is Sandbox defence game.
So there's a limit to plugins. (Unless I make AI)
Admins have been busy and tired of catching griefers every day, not playing games.
Not many multiplayer-only maps
There are more cases of building a meltdown or wave skip in just 15 waves.
Most discord/steam map isn't designed for multiplayer.
The solution is to create a map, but unlike other servers, my server is a solo development, so I don't have enough time to do plugin and server monitoring and map production at the same time.
When will this server come back?
After making new server contents
ex) Bullet hell (like a anuke's other games)

title: Block Fields for Modding
bodyText:
quickRotate: whether the block can be rotated with R(or Binding.rotateplaced) + Scroll Wheel.
This is because modded blocks are sometimes not meant to be rotated after placed, and a block cannot tell if it has been rotated unless it keeps track of its rotation, so in some cases it is better if the block is just not rotated at all after placed.
rotateArrow: whether the block placement is guided by the arrow icon.
This is because some modded block are using the rotation of the block in an "unintended" way, such as making only whether it was vertically or horizontally placed count(a.k.a only rotation%2 matters), and in some cases it just makes sense to get rid of the arrow icon.

title: Prevent plated conduits from leaking
bodyText:
implements the popular 🚀 suggestion from Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions#717

this prevents plated conduits from leaking at all due to the cap texture region forming a visible seal:

this also removes the leak resistance property from conduits because its a technical nightmare that has bugged me forever:

a resistance of exactly 100 would stop leaking, while it was actually a valid value.
it was not really intuitive, 1.5f would mean leak half, and 10f close to but not exactly a tenth?
https://github.com/topics/mindustry-mod?q=leakResistance no mod with this topic appears to use the property.
https://github.com/topics/mindustry-mods?q=leakResistance no mod with this topic appears to use the property.

so this commit reverts that addition made in #999 and just puts the conduit leak rate back at what it was before.
personally i think this is the best solution for the problem, because even though it did leak less you would still not want to leave it unconnected for long or all the pressure would still drain rapidly over time the longer the pipe was, so now you can actually lay a purple pipe while it is already filling with fluids but without wasting any of it vs a blue pipe, i feel like this would be a good improvement to make the 3rd tier stand out more from the 2nd tier, and the votes on the suggestion seem to agree 😃

(re)named it leaks instead of leak since it sounded a bit better, but i'll leave a clickable code suggestion for anuke :)

title: Make deconstructing scrap walls return scrap
bodyText:
found myself deconstructing some scrap walls on ruinous shores just now (ironically to uncover a scrap patch) and it dawned on me that scrap walls return nothing when deconstructing.
but now that the core can contain any item (including scrap) it would make sense that scrap walls return the expected amount.
even though you can't build them (yet) it just seems like a quality of life change.


to keep the theme of wall costs i have kept the size 1 cost 6 like the other walls, but maybe less would make some more sense since there are chunks missing in the texture, though ironically that would make it even worth more scrap.


sizes 3 and 4 are also multiplied from size 1 to make the calculation visibly easier to understand.


technically just a suggestion, feel free to either merge of close this at your discretion: @Anuken ❤️

title: Visualize maximum amount of power node wires
bodyText:
on the same ruinous shore map as my other pull request i ran into an old friend: 12f1ee9
(that commit lowered nerfed the max amount of power node connections)
people used to the normal wire count might expect to be able to link the water extractor to this node, as i have:

the only problem that there is no real visual indication of the node being full, clicking does nothing and the only hint as to why is in the core database.
i propose to add a bar to power nodes that list the max and current amount of connections:


the naming of its bar & bundle entry doesn't feel quite right, accepting suggestions on how to (re)name those*

title: allow mods to easily load icon region
bodyText:
It's troublesome to create icon regions for mods as the name is always <mod-name>-<sprite-name>, which means AtlasRegion with the name unit-examplemod-chrome-wraith is impossible, only examplemod-unit-chrome-wraith.
In this PR, I allow UnlockableContent to take icon regions just from <mod-name>-<sprite-name>-<cicon-name>. I'm kinda sure this will help modders a lot.

title: change surgealloy to surgeAlloy and phasefabric to phaseFabric
bodyText:
Currently, the game has the following names for materials with a two word name:
Items.sporePod
Items.blastCompound
Items.surgealloy
Items.phasefabric
It doesn't make much sense that sporePod and blastCompound each have the first letter of each word capitalized while surgealloy and phasefabric don't. That's what this PR fixes.

bodyText:
when resources for buildings are being used by several players on the map and the core lacks stuff, it desyncs.
i have had this on at the nydus v5 server for basically forever, and also turned it on for v6 bleeding edge.
in the previous version of the game it wasn't such a big deal, but this versions has a lot more expensive / larger builds.
while its weird to see the construction progress jump every ~8 seconds, its better than not having building accuracy.
(most noticeable with the higher tier reconstructors, where progress accuracy can easily shift by 25%)

maybe a smoother fix would be to send progress along with construction packets, but this is a least a good step ❤️

title: Keep items inside reconstructor when construction booped
bodyText:
its a pretty common occurrence that the reconstructor is deconstructed partially for a split second to clear out the unit currently stuck in there, the only problem is that it also gets rid of any items still remaining in there.
this pull does two things:

returns you all the items if you complete the partially deconstructed reconstructor again (must be the same block)
tags all deconstructing blocks with what they were so they can be restored if they have custom overwrote logic

during testing i found that you can place a larger reconstructor over a smaller one (and that does not transfer any compatible items), but i am leaving that outside the scope of this pull request (+ who even does that?)

0.35 is just my Log.info(progress) guess where i compared it visually, the sweet spot may lie slightly higher or lower.

title: Enable double-click to play sector
bodyText:
I have frequently double-clicked on a sector expecting to go to it immediately, only to realize I have to then click the "Go" button on the bottom of the screen.
This PR makes clicking on a sector that is already selected invoke the same action as the "Go/Resume/Launch" button. It is a QoL change that makes it easier to rapidly switch between sectors, without having to first click on a sector then move the mouse to the "Go" button. It changes very little code; the bulk of the changes was just moving the contents of a lambda function outside into its own function.
I originally intended to make it work only via double-click, but 2 separate clicks also work.

title: "[E] to enable building" hint while building is paused
bodyText:
Currently, when "auto-pause building" is off, no UI hint is shown when players press E to toggle pause/resume building, until they try to build something. Thus, they are left to guess what the current state of building is if they have pressed E multiple times. If they guess wrong, this can cause them to accidentally start building something when they only wanted to create a plan.
This PR makes it so that an "[E] to enable building" hint is a persistent indicator of the state of building (always displayed when building is paused) when auto-pause is off, regardless if building plans exist. It does not change how the hint is displayed when auto-pause is on.

title: Fix units aiming sidewards missing their aim
bodyText:
After writing the issue #3949, I took a look at the aiming code and noticed that in Predict::intercept, deltaX/Y of the source is divided by Time.delta, while the deltas of the target are not. The function then adds both together, and calls another overload of intercept, which divides by Time.delta again, meaning that source delta is divided twice.
Removing the division fixes the aiming issues described in the issue.

title: [Fastlane][RO] Steam Translation
bodyText:
Initial translation of Steam achievements. It's ready for merging.
Note: You will notice that the Steam description is still English. I will not translate it. For cultural reasons. This is intentional.
Here, in Romania, few games are translated, and fewer have their Steam descriptions translated. Translated Steam descriptions are so rare that they are unusual for high quality games, hence a game with translated descriptions may be seen as unprofessional when one first opens the Steam page. I translated the achievements though, because having a Romanian translation but English achievements will, again, look odd.
Google play descriptions are another story. Google Play is mainly frequented by kids, and Romanian translations are not unusual. Translating that could bring some Romanian-only speakers to the game.

title: Allow hidden blocks to be revealed by plugins
bodyText:
backstory: on nydus (bleeding edge) i often experiment with the hidden blocks like the forge, interplanetary accelerator, launchpads, etc, but to construct those i often come up with weird multiblock constructions or overriding existing blocks when placed, which is not ideal since it does not use the intended resources required for construction.
scope: this pull adds a custom rule that enables servers (with custom plugins can use, not much use outside of that for stuff like the 3 block payload ones) to make certain blocks visible without having to mess with sector rules or other weird server sided shenanigans, this would be a lovely solution.
technical: the check is duplicated in both the hidden and visible function since that is how its currently already doing it for just the buildvisibility check, mimicked that behaviour.
usage: probably not that much outside of servers that don't run specialized plugins to give the inert blocks some purpose, i forsee mostly myself using it on the aforementioned server, but its a relatively small chance to the code that won't really cause problems elsewhere or become totally unmanageable since its basically just 3 lines and won't get in the way anywhere.

rules add revealedBlocks [launch-pad]

title: Ask double pop-ups to create a public server
bodyText:
Mindustry steam server is friend only?
Not all players will play normally. griefers, kick command abuse...
This affects all users on that server.
But what if the user who first played the game gets into the steam server?
Most of them will be kicked out or ban as soon as they connect.
Even though players not doing anything.
So most users play the server on community servers..
I hope this resolves the server problem, but unfortunately, most community servers require authentication.
Because it's easy to cheating and too many griefers.
so why need this?
This's a problem that has been around since the launch of Steam.

It seemed to have been resolved by floating a public host check popup, but I understand that almost all players can't do it with friends unless they press YES.

I've seen a lot of servers that abuse kick and bans today, and to solve this, I fundamentally changed the sequence of buttons and created a double popup to solve the yes man.

title: Rebrand power infinite as power source
bodyText:
just some things that have been bothering me a bit:
naming
all other sandbox blocks are named either source or void, infinite is the odd one out
power
600k is just a weird number, this changes it to 10k per node, since its normal to need several item/liquid sources somewhere.
(calculation happens once in blocks.java since it results in 166.666666667 which would look ugly hardcoded in)
modding
any modded power sources (though i doubt (m)any of them exist) will default to what it was
verdict
i think this be a nice chance, the new power number might still be "high" compared to what e.g. the item source can output, but i don't wanna break existing saves that rely on a ton of power all to much, they probably didn't use all power anyways 🤔

title: Remove turret1 from uradar
bodyText:
This PR changes uradar's disabled from parameter's default value from "turret1" to "0".
uradar extends radar, thus inheriting all its default parameters. The from parameter does nothing in uradar, yet it is still prefilled with "turret1", which misleads players into thinking that this is some kind of hidden or "easter egg" parameter, as seen here. It also bloats schematic files with unnecessary bytes. The leftover "turret1" can be seen when copying logic code to the clipboard.
Before:
uradar enemy any any distance turret1 1 result
After:
uradar enemy any any distance 0 1 result

title: Allow for core incineration via rules
bodyText:
i would like to be able to play with core incineration on the nydus bleeding edge server:

once the core is full of something that production chain turns off, possibly causing power issues when some turn back on.
makes mixed conveyors (e.g. lead with glass) less of a problem when the core eventually fills up with something.
adds a nice challenge of having to balance production: not to little but also not too much
possibly brings some more logic into play, like disabling a conveyor once the core is full
no more need for impractical overflow + incinerator setups near the core
makes it more in like with what is expected through playing the campaign
maybe a few unforseen meta changes due to sideeffects, will be interesting
currently a base level rule instead of team rule, maybe some map makers would like it overridable per team though?
generally just interesting to experiment with, would be nice to have this for the time being on bleeding edge
yes, i could have just written a plugin that constantly sets it back to like 100 below the cap and spawn particles, but spamming all those packets is just not very efficient while a relatively harmful rule addition is objectively better

(false by default of course, its an opt-in)


naming might not be the best, could imply on whether or not the core is susceptible or not to catching fire 🔥

title: Add block info keybind
bodyText:
This PR adds a keybind (default: F1) that invokes the same action as clicking the "?" button while a block is selected or hovered in the placement menu. It is only usable in the same situations as when the "?" button is visible.
It saves players the effort of moving the cursor to that corner of the screen when picking blocks with middle-click or block select keys, and allows the functionality to be mapped to controller buttons if needed. It also allows the block info dialog to be opened without actually selecting a block (by just hovering and pressing F1), thereby saving players 2 clicks.
It does add yet another keybind, and provides quite a small QoL improvement, so I understand if you think this is superfluous and should not be added.
Added

Rework and Update of the french bundles (Steam and bundle_fr)
bodyText:
Complete rework of bundle_fr
Overview
Hello players. I made a pull in Mindustry-Suggestions about merging bundle_fr and bundle_fr_be. Anuke told he was unable to do that because:

I don't understand either language, so I would be unable to merge the two bundles with any degree of accuracy. This is best discussed and implemented by other speakers of the language(s).

So I decided to do that with the help of senri on discord and Voila. There is the updated version of the french bundle for Belgians, Frenchs, Quebecois and everyone else who speaks or learns french !
Changes
There are the words and the changes that french players may argue about:

1. FPS -> IPS
2. Raccourci clavier -> Touches
3. Foreshadow -> Présage
4. Mace -> Titan
5. Scepter -> Destructeur
6. Reign -> Eradicateur
7. Lancier -> Perforateur (Its just an idea)
8. Chat -> Tchat
9. Minuterie -> Compte à rebours (Makes more sense for the waves i think)
10. Minimap -> Mini-carte
11. Supporté -> Pas pris en charge (For errors, makes more sense)
12. Hébergeur -> Hôte (the shorter the better)
13. Foreuse à vérin -> foreuse pneumatique (I don't think being super precise might help normal players)
14. Onde -> Vague
15. Percussion -> Percuteur (C'est un nom qui percute !)
16. Deleted the (e) until the file is reviewed by more people
17. Made the whole file more coherent, I mean there were upper/lower case letters where it shouldn't be.
18. Added translations for V6 content like logic blocks, sector description, turrets, units...
19. Some more stuff I may have forgotten


Lines to verify in priority
Here are the lines with which I had difficulties
16, 23, 27, 37, 100, 109, 128, 129, 140, 153, 159, 189, 204, 229, 251, 282, 291, 321, 341, 421, 468, 482, 515, 536, [598 -> 613], 703, 705, 715, 751, 777, 1254, 1402

Conclusion
Like I said, I merged fr and fr_be, taking the best translations one by one and translating the missing lines (I even found v4 untranslated lines). That would be cool if you look quickly in the file and find some errors I could have made. Thank you for reading and I wish you a good day, or night...

title: Make schematics build insulated blocks first, power nodes last
bodyText:
This PR sorts the build order of schematics when placed, so that small plastanium walls will be pushed to the beginning of the build queue, and all power nodes to the end.
This change fixes the following issues:

Even though schematics in 6.0 remember power connections, that didn't matter at all as power nodes built halfway through the build order would often max themselves out with automatic connections before they could connect to their saved connections.
For schematics surrounded by plastanium walls, power nodes outside the schematic could still make automatic connections to blocks inside the schematic during construction because some blocks would be built before the insulator walls were.
Likewise, power nodes inside could make automatic connections out.
Blocks outside a schematic would often steal power nodes' automatic connections so that by the time a schematic finished building, no connections would be left and some blocks in the schematic would be left unpowered.
Schematics that used batteries to reduce the number of power connections needed would find some blocks left unpowered due to power nodes being constructed before some batteries, causing multiple automatic connections to be wasted on blocks that could have shared 1 connection via batteries.

Thus, schematics' power connections will look much neater after being built, and players will no longer have to waste time manually fixing bad automatic power connections.
As with anything involving build order, this PR does not address build order not being respected due to the player unit being out of build range. It also doesn't alter the build order of manually built designs.
Forgive these unrealistic, contrived examples.

title: Double-tap to mine, tap anywhere to cancel
bodyText:
This PR makes (mobile only) the first tap anywhere while mining stop mining, and adds an option to make mining require double-tap/click. This first tap does not interact with blocks, so that you won't accidentally invoke anything else.
You can still move while mining. Mobile double-tap prioritizes units, so it is easy to control units on top of ore.
Improvements to single-tap mining:

Mobile: Prevents mining by accident when you attempt to place a block on terrain with an obstruction.
Mobile: Prevents mining by accident when you tap on ore while breaking blocks.
Mobile: Tap anywhere to cancel mining. Mining was previously difficult to cancel, as you had to tap precisely on the tile you're mining, or move out of mining range.

Double-tap mining resolves the following issues:

Prevents mining by accident when you intend to tap/click on something else.
Prevents mining by accident when you intend to target/shoot an enemy. (Resolves suggestion #355.)

Desktop right-click to cancel mining is unchanged.
Discord discussion
@bluewolf3682 @GreyMario
Additionally, on mobile, the second tap of a double-tap will not configure blocks if a unit was tapped, and double-tap detects units on the first tap. This resolves the following issues:

Mobile: If a unit is on top of a bridge or power node, double-tapping the unit will not disconnect the bridge/node.
Mobile: Makes it easier to take control of moving units.

Discord discussion
Implementation notes
The desktop implementation perhaps could be cleaner and replace Time.millis() with count, but may require adding method(s) to Arc equivalent to tap() used for mobile, with support for keybinds. Introducing easy-to-use double-click methods to desktop may be useful for other things in the future.
Added

"Game → Double-Tap to Mine" setting (default unchecked)

Needs localization

"Double-Tap to Mine" setting name

title: Unit cap
bodyText:
Allows custom maps to be able to set unit caps, as well as enable or disable dynamic caps based on cores.
Mainly allows bigger maps and more cores without making the maps a lag-fest, and also allows for better difficulty control.
Negative values are only there to be able to offset core contributions in case someone wants dynamic caps but doesnt want to have them too high. Cap value resets to 0 if its negative.

title: Reshuffle nydus servers
bodyText:
this pull request adds an entry to the v6 server list, as well as reorganize its existing entries for v6 & bleeding edge:

(own sub-sub domain and unique sequential port where coincidentally the last number relates to the version)
be.mindustry.nydus.app:6567
v6.mindustry.nydus.app:6566
v5.mindustry.nydus.app:6565

as some were aware the v5 server ip landed you in "silicon valley", a small iq test map where you had to place a silicon smelter in order to get redirected to the actual server, this immensely reduced the amount of griefers and generally bad players.
for v6 i have come up with "disrepair", here the task for the player is to simply place down either mender to proceed:
the 3 hints the player gets:

map name is disrepair
mode name is puzzle
core is damaged

one of the first instincts of players should be to repair a damaged core. (besides, nothing else can be done on that map)
the moment they place down either a mender or mend projector they get sent to the actual server to join their peers.
when the last connected player leaves the map it gets reset to the below screenshot again, ensuring a clean slate.
lastly i'd like to mention that this pull which basically contains instructions on how to solve it doesn't break the concept, the goal for the player is to figure out how to make it through, doing it entirely by yourself / reading this / asking others / being told by others / etc are all valid ways, that is basically the gate, only players who can't figure out any of those get stuck.



i will be keeping an eye on how well it goes, should be on-par with silicon valley, and that turned out well enough ❤️

title: Add buildSpeedMultiplier status effect
bodyText:
This PR makes the disarmed status effect into a general "stops units from doing things" effect, by also preventing building. This makes disarmed effective against builder units like polys and megas.
This PR adds the buildSpeedMultiplier status effect. canBuild() returns false when this effect is ≤ 0.
Related: #4762

title: Display map names with underscores
bodyText:
Benefits

It makes it obvious how to host maps with spaces (thus removing questions such as #1247)
It allows to copy-paste a map name from the output of the maps command.

Drawbacks

It doesn't display the real name I guess?

Workarounds

Who cares for the real name. You can't use it in a command anyway.

Other approaches

It could be documented (ie. not just in an issue), but that would have to be discoverable and many people won't search for it.

title: Add `setupRequirements`, which calls `requirements` so that it can be used in rhino js.
bodyText:
This'll allow it to be used in rhino js without rhino having a stroke about it.
I chose to change the method instead of the property because changing the method only breaks Java mods while changing the property would break every non-java mods. Java mods would be easier to fix because you could just do a ctrl + h to replace every requirements with setRequirements (assuming all blocks are in one file like Mindustry source code) while in non-java mods you would have to go through every file individually and fix it.
(I'm sorry sk)

title: they have a  n a m e
Refactored duplicated tests into a parameterized one
bodyText:
Problem:
Classes containing test methods with repeated test code steps, typically, parts that set up test fixtures, generate additional effort in case of test maintenance.
Solution:
Parameterized tests make it possible to run a test multiple times, with different arguments, as individual and independent tests. In this refactoring, no original assertion parameter was changed. A further refactoring can also be applied as soon as JUnit 5 library version is updated to at least version 5.7, which is indicated in test class.

title: Added addUpgrade method to Reconstructor to avoid dealing with incompatible Rhino JS Array
bodyText:
With this PR, scripts in mods will be able to add unit upgrade plans to reconstructors without wrangling with Rhino JS arrays.
Rhino's NativeArray cannot be used like a traditional Java array when adding to a sequence of arrays since it neither extends nor can it be casted as Java's Array. The new method addition addresses this by accepting two UnitTypes instead of an array of them and initializing a Java Array on the spot.
Any scripts that previously had a hacky way of handling this issue will continue to function still.

title: Make PathCost interface public

title: Fixed unit logic controller updating
bodyText:
Under the current behavior, a unit will not update its highlighted processor until it is no longer logic-controlled, even if it receives new instructions from another processor. With this fix, the highlighted processor will always be one from which it last received instructions. This will also fix the @controller sensor value to reflect this change.
Incorrect behavior:
ubind @flare
ucontrol approach @thisx @thisy 3 0 0
op sub @counter @counter 1


With the fixed behavior, the highlighted processor should be the one farthest to the right.

Eu mudei algumas coisas que estavam ou erradas, tinham erros de português ou simplesmente soavam estranhas e também adicionei um monte de coisa que ainda não estava traduzida.
o bundle modificado foi testado como um mod simplesmente salvando o arquivo de texto modificado na pasta do mod de teste, mas acredito que também vá funcionar certinho quando colocado no código fonte em si até porque é algo simples.
Não é tudo que foi traduzido ainda, lógica e suas dicas ainda tem que ser traduzidas. Acredito que outras coisas também, foi não fiz uma revisão geral no jogo em português para saber, mas acredito que a maioria deve de estar traduzido agora

title: Always increment launchpad counter
bodyText:
After switching from timer to incrementing launchCounter (28b235e#diff-1a24378e67f837237740bfb4613e955e9d21250b0adc0a94db1515cbed7680de), launch pads wait until their capacity is full before starting the countdown. Assuming that was unintentional, this change makes the countdown start immediately again.
Also, if a launch pad does not have full power, it will do nothing except drain power. Removing efficiency() >= 1f allows the launch pad to work, but at a slower rate.

title: [Bundle][RO] Update
bodyText:
Changelog:

New strings/changes up to commit 1b0de73
Team names are now capitalized (not the first to do that) and standardized to male singular. And I wouldn't change something if it wouldn't be pretty broken... In previous versions, the blue team ({0} team) would just be echipa albastră (echipa {0}). So team.blue.name is albastră, team adjective is female singular. Plain and simple, no headaches. However, given the changes in a5fe897, [#0000FF]blue[] core ([#{0}]{1}[] core) could now become nucleu albastră, this combination of male noun and female adj which is plain infuriating if you care the slightest bit about perfection (and when you think this may not be the only language affected...). Yeah, nuclee Albastru (instead of albastre) doesn't sound ideal either, but I figured out it's the best that can be done using only bundle modifications. echipa Steaua, echipa Albastru, nucleu Albastru, nuclee Albastru... echipa Abandonat, echipa unde totul este abandonat, unde găsești un nucleu Abandonat sau două... Etc, etc. It's the best fit IMO.
Since Агрессоры is our perfect slavic latin? Anuke-approved word, and Crux is expected to get more lore in the far or near future, I decided to go for it. team.crux.name = Agresor (Special thanks to the Russian translators)
Typo fixes & various other improvements

title: Hidden blocks only in the Placement UI
bodyText:
when the blocks are sus.
Hides the block from the player. This is different from BuildVisibility; The player & the world can still interact with the block (e.g. payload sources, picking up blocks) but it will not show up in the placementFragment, thus preventing the player from placing down those blocks manually.
Not intended to be perfect (can be easily bypassed), but to prevent giving overwelming the player with too many similar blocks or something, to be used in mods.

title: Avoid ambiguity
bodyText:
When you see 'boost: 150%'
It can be 'increase the speed to 150%' or 'increase the speed to 1+150%, which is 250% in total'. Boost can either be verb or be noun.
Maybe you will say that the colon has already avoided this ambiguity.
But you know there's always someone who ignores those things, and translating 'boost' is hard with nothing to avoid ambiguity.
Previous:
With a 'x', it will show 'Boost: x150%', which will never be thought as 1+150%.
Latest:
With a '+', it will show 'Boost: +50%', which not only avoid ambiguity, but also can show 'Boost: +0%' when power is not enough to hold the overdrive using Math.max. Also it makes traslation way more easier.

title: [Bundle][RO] Update
bodyText:
Changelog:

New strings/changes up to commit 5d4ab9e
Changed team.derelict.name to Ruină. It used to be Abandonat, which worked at the time, since team names were all adjectives and AFAIK Romanian doesn't have a proper adjective translation of derelict, one that's also suitable for a team name (Cine ar juca cu echipa părăsită sau echipa abandonată?). As team names are no longer necessarily adjectives, and Abandonat didn't really reflect both sides of derelict: abandoned and in poor condition, it was time for a change. (Special thanks to @jrtrinny)
Typo fixes & various other improvements

title: [Bundle][RO] Update
bodyText:
Changelog:

New strings/changes up to commit caa34c9
Let's face it: overclock doesn't really have a translation and likely won't ever receive one. I partially tried to avoid the issue by using overdrive as a substitute, but it was bound to fail, as overdrive as a status would later be exposed. Now, overclockat is a thing, but I'd say our language created... whatever that is... out of necessity; it does really not sound right. Would you rather say Mi-am făcut overclock la calculator. or Mi-am overclockat calculatorul.? IDK and I don't care whether overclockat is widespread or not, but I'd rather keep it as it is: overclock. Completely untranslated,  still awkward, but much less awkward.
status >>> stare. Yeah, status did indeed remain from latin and with the recent increase in people using it with the English meaning it doesn't always sound all that unnatural. However, as I've come to learn, in Romanian its meaning is much less broad. The dictionary effectively redirects you to statut. So status social works just as statut social works. But to say my status: I'm wet >>> starea mea: sunt ud. So yeah, it's not like in English.  Imagine saying statusul meu: sunt ud; this sounds as bad as saying forch instead of  fork.
Typo fixes & various other improvements

title: Wave graph y axis refactor
bodyText:
The main change is that the health and total graphs actually show the health and total amounts, as opposed to keeping the count amounts.
Preview:

Full changelog:

nextStep obtains the next step in a 1 -> 2 -> 5 -> 10 -> 20... sequence for cleaner graph intervals.
maxY determines the maximum amount the Y value should reach.
maxY also determines the amount of padding for the axis labels.
The number of vertical sections in the graph are clamped to 10, which should be reasonable, as opposed to the relatively large amounts it reaches if the graph size is used.
There is a mostly transparent horizontal line on each graph mark, for reference. It does not interfere with the graph itself much, but provides a nicer reference point compared to trying to guess where it is.
Minor formatting fixes because spacing was strange for some reason.

title: Cryo tiles
bodyText:
Since all the other liquids have tile versions that can be used in maps, i figured cryofluid should also have said tile variant. It provides an interesting new liquid tile to work with that goes very nicely with cold themed maps. Notable properties and related potential reasoning:
The cryofluid pools could have been formed over a long time as titanium slowly dissolved into water, or could be remnants of the accidents from previous unknown civilizations.
The pools are shallow, and such cold temperatures reduces pump efficiency, making extraction slower.
(50% pump efficiency because everyone was crying about this being op)
The pools glow faintly with a slightly blue tint.
(Is cryo radioactive? Why does it emit light as a liquid? Idk but if the liquid does then the tile should too i guess)
Since cryofluid is much less viscous than tar or slag, drowning units only have a 50% debuff to speed when going through it, as opposed to an 80% for the other two. They are of course affected with the freezing status effect.
Also made a shader for the fluid that sort of mimicks a 'freezing' effect, the effect is a bit subtle and the shader looks similar to tar and slag when zoomed out:

  
    
    

    cryo.mp4

title: Added 2 versatile trigger event types
bodyText:
Trigger#drawOver: My drawn things' Z layer broke using Events.run(Trigger.draw, () -> Draw.draw(z, ...)), for some reason. I had my suspicions on the mesh rendering of floors since it flushes the sprite batch, which isn't probably the issue, but whatever.
SaveWriteEvent: As opposed to SaveLoadEvent, this event is fired when writing the save file. Tested by doing:

Run these in the JS console fragment:

Events.on(SaveLoadEvent, () => Log.info(Vars.state.rules.tags.get("do", "would")));.
Events.on(SaveWriteEvent, () => Vars.state.rules.tags.put("do", "did ;)"));.


Launch to a map. The JS console should print out [I] would.
Exit to the main menu, and go back to that map via loading its save slot. The JS console should print out [I] did ;).

title: Saved games search & Mapsearch filter improvements
bodyText:
Changed the UI of the filter menu to be a bit cleaner:

The gamemodes are now just icon buttons with a hover tooltip of the gamemode name. The table is labelled so there wont be confusion for which one is which.
You can hide/show both custom maps and default maps, in case someone wanted that.

Also added an option to toggle including map description and author in the search filter, both of these can be independantly toggled.
This is mostly because #6075 introduced the extra searching options but the way they were added was a bit vague, so i figured i might as well just clean up the entire filter menu and add them in as well, plus extra functionality is nice. Demo:

  
    
    

    fancy_menu.mp4
    
  

  

  


Also added search for saved games. Details:

The search is identical to map search.
The filters are buttons on the bar, since there are only gamemode filters. Custom/inbuilt maps and extra searching parameters dont really exist.
Changed the "No saves found!" to just be text instead of a disabled button for consistency.

Demo:

  
    
    

    save-search.mp4
    
  

  

  


Also this is entirely unrelated to this pr, but about half of the default maps don't have an internal author name, but the preview shows Anuke as the author name. This does make specific search results a bit strange, since you expect to see the map, but you don't.

title: Better Mod/Plugin dependencies handling
bodyText:
Currently, all plugins are loaded, instantiated and then sorted, this leads to ClassNotFound exceptions if you dare to use static classes of other Plugins outside the init or if you try to create a general purpose Plugin classes like a AbstractGamemodePlugin for example that may be optimized for game mode plugins.
The solution is simple, resolving dependencies before loading anything, it features:

more complex dependency trees
detecting missing dependencies
preventing circular dependencies

The code is tested and it works fine, It's just that the structure of Mods is a bit hard to follow, so I need your opinion on how the missing/circular dependencies should be handled and what to do with the dependencies and missingDependencies fields of LoadedMod.
Thanks for reading.

title: Allow Custom input handling in servers
bodyText:
Currently, you can't really customize the input system of a Mindustry server unless using some really unsafe code to stop reading Thread. So this PR aims to change that by just setting a runnable before ServerLoadEvent. This change allows:

bodyText:
Ammo.Transmutation.mp4
    
  

  

  


What is happening in the video?

1 pyratite is put into the swarmer. This adds 5 pyratite ammo.
4 pyratite ammo are shot. 1 is left
1 blast compound is put into the swarmer. Now there is 1 pyratite ammo and 5 blast compound ammo.
4 blast compound ammo are shot. 1 is left
The final 2 shots should be 1 blast compound bullet and 1 pyratite bullet, however 2 blast compound bullets come out instead.

title: Apply color stripping to player names in console wherever applicable.
bodyText:
Have you ever looked at the console of a semi active server with players who know how to use color codes and a simple little formatted tag on their name? No? Here have a look:

It is painful to read.
This PR:

Adds two utility methods, one to Player called plainName() that returns Strings.stripColors(name) and one to PlayerInfo called plainLastName() that does the same thing with lastName.
Replaces all usage of the Player.name and PlayerInfo.lastName in console contexts (displaying and comparing in console commands) with the method variant for the stripped version.
Shows an [A] or [P] tag for the players and status command as an admin status indicator instead of a verbose boolean indicator. (image below)
Adds the uuid to the logs for admin actions so its easier to keep track. Player names are unreliable.
Displays both plain and raw names for trace info.
Various formatting fixes in the files changed because formatter did its thing.


(ignore the underlining on IP, intellij console thinks its a URL for whatever reason)

title: Update bundle_ko.properties
bodyText:
용어 통일 및 변경


medium : 긴 단어를 비슷한 의미인 "보통"으로 변경
unit - "기체"로 통일
biomass - 포자의 목적을 고려하여 ( 전력 생산의 원료) "생물자원"으로 번역
at enemy - "~을 향해"로 통일. 예외 : 호라이즌과 쿼드는 현재 위치에 탄환을 투하하므로 "~에"로 작성함.
이 외에도 같은 문장이지만 다른 의미로 해석된 문단 통일


불필요한 설명 삭제 및 간소화


자원 : 추후 추가적인 번역 수정이 필요함.
번역 원문에 없는 부가적인, 굳이 필요하지 않는 설명 삭제
직역 지향


details에서 커뮤니티 밈 혹은 개드립 삭제


특정 커뮤니티에 속하지 않은 유저의 시선에서 보았을 때, 이해하기 힘든 문구들 삭제
게임과 관련된, 유용한 팁을 추가하는 것이 여러모로 좋을 것 같음. 추후 수정 필요.


Unify and change terms


medium: Change the long word to "보통" which means something similar
Unit - Unify as "기체"
Biomass - Translated as "생물자원" (raw material for power production) considering the purpose of spores
at enemy - Unify as "~을 향해". Exception: Horizon and Quad drop bullets at their current location, so write "~에"
In addition to this, paragraph unification, which is interpreted in different ways in the same sentence


Delete and simplify unnecessary comments


Resources: Additional translation modifications are required later.
Delete additional, unnecessary descriptions that are not in the original translation
a literal orientation


Delete a community meme or comment from details


Delete phrases that are hard to understand when viewed from the perspective of users who do not belong to a particular community
I think it would be good to add useful tips related to games in many ways. Need to be corrected later.

title: Use sprites instead of polygons
bodyText:

The visual quality of these effects has also been improved as Lines.circle leads to aliasing and the sprites are smooth because of downsapling. The shape and size of the effects was not changed.

title: [ES] bundle_es.properties quality fixes
bodyText:
Several fixes that make the game descriptions much more intuitive, accurate, logical and grammatically correct.
Some of the main noteworthy changes:

Finally decided to use "Esquemas" for "Schematics", instead of "Plantillas". (There are a few diferent words to use for this concept but wasn't sure wich one would fit better.)
Conduit-related elements should use "Tubería", besides "Conducto" is more appropiate for "Duct" elements (wich are called "Túnel" to easily distinguish them.)
Correctly conjugated verbs and reduced use of uppercases on common words to maintain correct spelling on as many strings as possible.
Greatly improved the requirements needed to unlock new main sectors.
Included a few more separate untranslated strings.
Slightly improved the name of some main sectors in Serpulo.
And many more little changes.

(Also updated my contributor name to match my GitHub username. Thanks for the attention <3).

title: german erekir & v7 translation
bodyText:
Original PR text below.
Is ready to merge whenever Erekir is ready for translations, but will be kept up to date until then.
Original text:
Cleans up missing translation. Leaving as draft for now as Erekir is not done and missing some bundle entries (e.g. the tutorial) and because there are some things I'm not quite sure about yet.
Ich habe ein Paar der neuen Übersetzungen (von @end-me-please) geändert, damit die anderen Namen besser passen, das wären:

Gelber Stein -> Gelbstein
Roter Stein -> Rotstein
Berylliumhaltiger Stein -> Berylliumstein
Rotes Eis -> Roteis

Diese Übersetzungen sind zwar vielleicht nicht ganz richtig, aber es sollte sich jeder denken können, was gemeint ist, und sie passen bei Sachen wie "Gelbsteinschlot" meiner Meinung nach einfach besser.
Mir fehlen jedoch Ideen für viele der neuen Einheiten und Geschösse:
block.breach.name = Breach
block.sublimate.name = Sublimate
block.diffuse.name = Diffuse
unit.vanquish.name = Vanquish
unit.conquer.name = Conquer
unit.avert.name = Avert
unit.disrupt.name = Disrupt
unit.evoke.name = Evoke
unit.incite.name = Incite
unit.emanate.name = Emanate
unit.elude.name = Elude
unit.obviate.name = Obviate
Einfach die Infinitivformen im Deutschen zu nehmen ergibt keine vernünftigen Namen (Durchbrechen, Stören). Fällt vielleicht einem anderen Übersetzer etwas ein?

title: format infinities
bodyText:
Why?
Power voids currently report -214748364.7b/s as a combined result of Strings.fixed being broken with large enough floats and UI.formatAmount using longs internally. Instead of fixing the issue at the root, I recognized that (long)(Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY) and the positive countepart only have one cast. I just want Bar hell to be gone.

title: german translation (again)
bodyText:
German translation yet again
I don't mean to be annoying by constantly opening a new PR as the old one is merged, just want to ensure there's a translation for newish features available.
To my fellow translators @end-me-please and @Shawak - I saw the Serpulo sector names and personally think it would be better to either find a translation for all of them or to leave them all English, not a half-half as we have now. I'd suggest the below (not committed yet), do you have any thoughts / things you would change?
I'm unsure about Ground Zero and Impact 0078, they seem like terminology / names as opposed to the other more descriptive names so I've left them as they were for now.

title: More Optimized Unloaders (Serpulo)
bodyText:
Made the unloaders' code cleaner, easier to read, and more optimized.
In a nutshell:

They work on a reduced list of surrounding buildings (updated with onProximityUpdate) to filter out the blocks they can never interact with (examples: wall, power node, water extractor...).
This avoids wasting time calculating the stats for something that never gets used, and allows for saving the block list and avoids recreating it everytime unloaders update.
Multiple tiny optimisations everywhere, deleted unused bits, and merged the null/set item behaviors into a single method for better consistency and readability

Big contribution by @citrusMarmelade
Thanks to Yo#0176 for hours spent bug testing

 I have read the contribution guidelines.

bodyText:
The problem currently appears on HeatCrafter.
LiquidConsumer efficiency is not multiplied by heat efficiency, causing it works as usual at only 100% consumption of liquid if heat efficiency > 100%. Doesn't happen on < 100% heat.
Before, right-side crucible works with 300% heat & 48/s slag, working as fast as the left one, which consumes 120/s slag. The slag input should be 120/s by calculating.

After.

This pr works properly but may not be a good implement I think.

title: Community server search
bodyText:
Adds a searchbar to the community servers menu. If there is a search query, a server is only displayed if its displayed text contains the query on refresh (e.g. with the search button).
While there's a lot of small improvements that could be made on top (e.g. allowing searching with regex, excluding group/map/server names, highlighting matches...), I felt this is good enough for things like "all attack maps" or "just this server group" without requiring a lot of changes.

title: Better Duplicate Op Support (json/hjson) + 1 more op
bodyText:
Better support for using mul, sin, and curve (json/hjson)

mul now checks for "amount" similarly to add
sin checks for "offset", and inputs it if it exists. Otherwise 0 is input for the offset
curve now checks for "interp" similarly to add


Added compress

Uses Mathf.curve, so you could make something that starts with a delay and ends early without having to use delay and shorten together and calculate what the amount put into shorten should be because delay already is shortening the time span blah blah
I don't know if "compress" is the best name for the op but it's what I came up with.

title: Added `autoPause` config for servers
bodyText:
autoPause pauses the server while nobody is online.
This is useful especially for private servers because it means, that you won't have to worry about getting destroyed by waves while you are offline. You can just continue playing when you rejoin.
It is implemented as a Config and is disabled by default.

title: Support for custom menu buttons
bodyText:
Added support for custom main menu buttons, similarly to custom categories in SettingsMenuDialog. Mods can register new menu buttons by using one of the MenuFragment.addButton methods, e.g. Vars.ui.menufrag.addButton("die", Icon.none, () -> throw Error()). For convenience, the quit button is always kept in the bottom right / bottom part of the menu, so the custom buttons are inserted between it and other buttons.
MenuFragment.Buttoni was made public and is now used to store the registered "button definitions"... I'm not sure if this is the best approach, but it works.

title: GitHub Workflows security hardening
bodyText:
This PR adds explicit permissions section to workflows. This is a security best practice because by default workflows run with extended set of permissions (except from on: pull_request from external forks). By specifying any permission explicitly all others are set to none. By using the principle of least privilege the damage a compromised workflow can do (because of an injection or compromised third party tool or action) is restricted.
It is recommended to have most strict permissions on the top level and grant write permissions on job level case by case.

title: Expand getBlock functionality
bodyText:
Let's the player use getBlock to detect water, floor, and ore tiles.
A reimagining of pr #6956, but now it doesn't break old logic, and still adds the majority of its function.
Simply adds a boolean input to getBlock (in the same fashion as unitLocate's enemy boolean) that lets you choose to search for floor tiles instead of block tiles. When used and a non-air overlay tile is present (ie. ores) it will default 'floor' to that, otherwise it will return the floor tile in 'floor'.
The main goal here was being able to make cool logic-based maps, detect water to allow (shitty) pathfinding, and have a more precise method of detecting ores.
Tested to make sure old logics are unchanged on this branch (simply because you already have 5 variables for unitControl thanks to build, all the considered problems are already solved)
Also changed the bundle description of getBlock to reflect this.

title: Precision errors in float to string methods
bodyText:
Related to Anuken/Arc#124, "About the other autoFixed()" paragraph. Since the pull request got accepted, it is necessary to copy the changes from Arc's autoFixed(value, maxPrecision) to Mindustry's fixValue(value) to make sure a correct precision is used.
The two methods were practically the same, so I replaced all occurrences of fixValue() with autoFixed() and made fixValue() deprecated. As far as I know fixValue() was used only in the StatValues class and nowhere else (not even some mods I briefly checked). I was tempted to delete it altogether, but decided to deprecate it instead since it is a public method.
I managed to find only 2 stats that were not displayed properly before the fix: Precept's speed (4.80 -> 4.8) and healing from Overdrive status (0.60 -> 0.6).

title: Mod dependency resolution improvements
bodyText:
This pull request introduce some improvements and bugfixes for the dependency resolution mechanism introduced in #6328 with :

Support for soft dependencies: This aims to make hooking into a soft-depended plugin safe by guaranteeing it's always initialized before the plugins that use it.
A better resolution algorithm: Improved to give more information about invalid mods, avoiding to resolve them another time later in the code.
Fixed a bug where the mod initialization order is not guaranteed to be kept after the initial resolution.

title: Additional block build over options
bodyText:
This PR just assigns some blocks that didn't have a group to some existing block groups so that you can build them over their similar counterparts, except for payload conveyors/routers which was reassigned to the payload group instead of the transportation group. The use cases are below:
-Vent condensers can be built over turbine condensers and vice versa
-Duct unloaders and electrolyzers can be built over themselves for easier rotating
-Payload conveyors no longer assume you want to erase normal conveyors you're building over
-Payload blocks like loaders and unloaders can be built over Payload conveyors
From what I can tell the only other place block groups are used besides building over blocks is for the SuicideAI that crawlers have, however that doesn't matter for vent/turbine condensers and duct unloaders since they're on Erekir. Though payload conveyors can now be targeted but afaik that shouldn't be an issue.

bodyText:

Currently, unit.spawnedByCore is not set correctly in UnitChangeEvent.
This is because the function that fires it (unit.controller(player)) does not seem to run any important code, but it actually runs player.unit(unit) which fires the event.
This was easily fixed by setting spawnedByCore first.

title: Adding a new menu type.
bodyText:
Added a new menu type that allows invisible transitions between different menus with the same id.
This opens the door for more interactive menus ..without giving players epilepsy.

Works the same as a normal menu. (Uses Dialog and Call.chooseMenu())
Does not break plugins.
The saved dialog is always freed in the end. (By client or server)

I see no reasons why not to add it, since they work the same as normal menus and give developers more tools to work with.
First video shows with the classic menu.
Second video shows with the new menu.
Third video shows a loading screen with the new menu.

title: Fixing Call.menu() not hiding on option selection.
bodyText:
When 3 hours of testing gets thrown in the garbage by a single refactoring...
I was calling UI.hide() instead of Dialog.hide(), now fixed.
Tests ran before this PR

(Menu) if closeOnBack gets called.
(Menu) if the buttonListener get called + if it has the correct option.
(Menu) if hidden after the option selection.
(FollowUpMenu) if closeOnBack gets called.
(FollowUpMenu) if the button listener gets called + if it has the correct option.

I went with Cons2<Integer, Dialog> (to replace) instead of having a boolean hideMenu to allow easier maintenance (if ever needed) in the future.
(Stupid example that gives the point: hiding the menu with no delay when option = -2.)

title: More Dark UI in stats display
bodyText:
This is only the beginning.
The most painful Pull Request I've ever made.
With a few hundreds debugging and headaches later, I've finished it.
Replace boring and uninformative old UI with the new, still uninformative, DARK UI.

Oh wow this looks so cool, I wonder what's the code behind it... (don't)

Hey this looks cool too huh, but it's kinda look crowded... (if only there is no mobile platform to consider)

Damn these looks nice, but where's the item rate?!?! (I couldn't figure out how to really convert mine speed to item/sec, so I, well, just removed it, simple solution)

OMG 🤯 😱 👍 THEY GOT THE PHASE BOOST (The force projector's coolant speed boost is kinda misleading, maybe I should remove it... like the units mine tier)

OH MY LORD THIS IS THE BEST FEATURE 😱 (still in beta... really)
And onto the main feature of this Pull Request...

WHATTT, liquid unit got the PIPE now?!?!? (seriously, please suggest a better icon than pipe, I kinda... don't like it)
Okay maybe we should end this here before the Dark UI takes over this Pull Request.
Still, this is only the beginning, The Attack Of the Dark UI is coming soon... or maybe when I have the free time.

title: Search bar for wave UI
bodyText:
Heavily stripped down and not heresy version of #5977, so apparently I did the funny Ctrl-C Ctrl-V and branded it as a new Pull Request.
Added search bar for wave info UI, a filter next to it because it feels too empty without one, and probably fixed other editor UI things.

  
    
    

    searchbar.mp4
    
  

  

  


Type a number, and the graph on the right will shift to the number inputted, the wave group on the left will change to only show the unit that will spawn in the wave that is the number you inputted too.

The filter icon next to the search bar, when clicked, will show a selection of units to choose, and that unit will be the unit the wave group pane will only show.
Apparently in the old PR, I have overcomplicated it, it was a big hassle and no one would use it anyways so stick to only the useful ones for now.

Moving on to one of the smaller things, moved the filter button to be next to the add button exactly like the old PR.

Reordered and resized this edit dialog to be consistent with the generation ones and the next target is the logic one.

Okay and great tooltips everywhere in case it isn't obvious enough and make use of the <none> now that there is <none found> replacing almost all of its uses
And probably several internal things I could not care less to mention about it because apparently people wants to only see interesting things and not uninteresting things
Oh and maybe I should mentions some editor UI things too small to be a separate Pull Request and as well name it random UI shit, so I might as well use the old PR tactic of sticking smaller changes with a big UI changes.

Updated one of the most hidden dialog, to a new flat UI.

extended the search bar of the editor, so more words can be shown, and it looks better that way.

so added a search icon to search bar, so that they searchingly searches for the search that you have searched for correctly.
Okay that's it, I should write less in an otherwise self-explanatory PR sometimes, might as well be just a video and some texts next time, people in general are not so keen at reading more than eight sentences.

Also rearranged wave sending and wave timer so the rules look more clean when wave timer is disabled, and make everything disabled when waves rule is off.
NOTE: how would wave limit in PvP works? since the winning team will always be the defaultTeam.
