title: Better handling of missiles splitting to other missiles (Done correctly this time)
bodyText:
Pass a shooter separate to owner into BulletType#create. killShooter kills the owner while the shooter is passed into the missile ai
killShooter no longer kills already dead units
MissileAI no longer aims at shooter's aim pos if the shooter is dead

If your pull request is not translation or serverlist-related, read the list of requirements below and check each box:

 I have read the contribution guidelines.
 I have ensured that my code compiles, if applicable.
 I have ensured that any new features in this PR function correctly in-game, if applicable.

 Missile-shooting units do not kill themselves
 Case 1: Missile unit's weapon's bullet is another missile unit.

UnitTypes.disrupt.weapons.first().bullet.spawnUnit.weapons.first().bullet = UnitTypes.quell.weapons.first().bullet
Spawned units follow the original disrupt's aim.


 Case 2: Missile unit's weapon's bullet's frags produce missile units.

UnitTypes.disrupt.weapons.first().bullet.spawnUnit.weapons.first().bullet.fragBullet = UnitTypes.quell.weapons.first().bullet
Spawned units do not follow the original disrupt's aim, but also do not track towards 0, 0 anymore.

Since the bullet's owner is the missile, it then passes that missile down through its frags as the next missile's shooter, however since I made MissileAI not rotate towards aim pos if the shooter is dead, the missiles do not track toward 0, 0. Just make the weapon shoot multiple missiles instead of using frag.




 What other extraneous cases are there for me to test?

title: Improvements to the Schematics UI
bodyText:
Just another random UI PR, but apparently the schems one gets the most changes somehow.
Added a search message text to the search bar, and make the buttons overlay-ed.

Changed the styles of these buttons so they won't show ugly square around the icon when you click it.

Also improved the edit tags dialog, to make it more fancy and organized, now with 4 buttons (and probably just that, well because there is not enough place to put another button right now)

Added Export and Edit button into the info dialog of the schematic, so you can export or edit right away when you save a schematic.

also renamed the "rename schematic" to edit schematic, to better reflect what it does (and also resized the save and cancel button)

Added icons to icon tags, I dunno why this doesn't existed in the first place but it's here now.

On to the map load dialog, this one is smaller than the schems one, but it sure does change a lot.
Make use of the makeButtonOverlay(), changes button width and style, pretty much changes everything I guess (still looks the same.)

lastly, correctly adjusted the width of the search bar of the content selection.

I should also mention that Anuken/Mindustry-Suggestions#4443 is a very interesting suggestion to consider, but right now I don't know how to approach it.
I should stop doing UIs somehow, but these things don't break anyone's game when something gone wrong sooo

So according to rules:


Set an appropriate MOTD, name and description. This is set with config <name/desc/motd> <value>. "Appropriate" means that:
Your name or description must reflect the type of server you're hosting.
Since new players may be exposed to the server list early on, put in a phrase like "Co-op survival" or "PvP" so players know what they're getting into. Yes, this is also displayed in the server mode info text, but having extra info in the name doesn't hurt.
Make sure players know where to refer to for server support. It should be fairly clear that the server owner is not me, but you.
Try to be professional in your text; use common sense.


But this server broke the rules by slandering others reputation:

title: Aegires Nerf
bodyText:
Nerfed healing (3% to 1.5% on non-aegires, 0.5% on aegires) because 3% resulted in large groups of aegires healing eachother faster than damage (from endgame, surge tier defenses (aegires is phase tier)) could be dealt, 1 omura (a T5) has large issues trying to kill 2 aegires (T4s) when the healing is 3%
Buffed segments (reload 6 frames to 4 frames, 25 damage to 30 damage)
This is because aegires are overpowered as hell when in groups

title: Unnecessary Drawer Icon Adding
bodyText:
It doesn't make sense for drawers like DrawLiquidTile to return the block's region in its icons. Overriding in every such class doesn't make as much sense as simply changing the superclass. Since icons(Block block) now returns an empty array by default unless overridden, an extra check was added to finalIcons(Block block) to ensure that there's at least one region in the array.

title: Add marker instruction to world processors
bodyText:
Code changes:

Add wproc-controlled markers sequence (IntMap) to Rules (each marker has its own identifier)
New Marker instruction for world processors
Add hidden boolean and some controlling methods to ObjectiveMarker for use in world processors
Add new LineMarker to objective markers
ObjectiveMarker writer/reader methods in TypeIO, new @Remote setMarker() method

P.S: New TypeIO methods read/write a single marker data, not the whole sequence. And the whole markers sequence isn't being synced except server's Rules sync. This is probably more optimized and creates an opportunity to desync markers between server and clients (for example, this is really useful for displaying different markers text depending on player's selected locale).
This is my first PR ever, so i could have screwed up anywhere in the code, even though i tested these features on both client and local server as much as i could

title: Add privileged desynced client global variables
bodyText:
A bit controversial feature: added new global variables @clientLocale, @clientUnit, @clientName, @clientTeam
These variables are used for managing custom world processor desync, which is weird, but allows displaying different information to different players. The implementation also required making these variables available only to privileged processors, as regular processors shouldn't be able to get client unit wherever it is.

bodyText:
Really messy PR adding map-specific locale bundles for map objectives and world processors. And i'm 80% sure there's something i forgot to fix or change.
Change list:

Format (replacing placeholders in text buffer)
Print Locale (privileged) (printing locale bundles properties to text buffer using current player's selected locale (prints ???propertyname??? on server)).

Made new dialog in Map Editor > Map Info for setting map locale bundles. Supports copying and pasting bundles as text.
Made map locale bundles support displaying mobile tips (searches for properties with names ending in ".mobile." first if you are on mobile device), but still added @clientMobile global var, may be useful too

bodyText:

makes you able to use smaller units as meatshields for your larger units and makes foreshadow bad for killing smaller units
hold off on merging for a day so we can potentially discuss this more, it's fine if i say nothing by then
might break extremely hard attack maps which require you to use foreshadow to snipe nodes (...gigafort?) or pvp maps where advancing is so hard that you have to snipe enemy nodes

title: Move Surge Alloy in ErekirTechTree to the correct position
bodyText:
Surge Alloy can be first obtained on the "Ravine" map.
Thorium can be first obtained on the "Caldera" map.
The "Ravine" map must be unlocked and completed before the "Caldera" map can be accessed.
Since Surge Alloy isn't required to produce Thorium (and vice versa), they should appear at the same level of the tech tree, under Tungsten.

title: Markers update
bodyText:
This branch required some force-pushing due to serious skill issues (so I couldn't reopen previous PR)
Changes:

Texture markers (able to draw any single texture from the game, limitless)
Markers now support drawing on different z layers (marker rendering moved from OverlayRenderer.drawTop() to Renderer.draw())
Added minimap mode to other markers (default minimap marker just ignores this value), added autoscale option for markers.
null values now make marker control methods use previous values instead of converting null to 0 (small changes in LExecutor, MapObjectives), removed redundant marker control operations.
Minor locale bundles dialog fixes.
Added color pickers to some logic instruction where it's useful (new col() method in LStatement).
Swap 1st and 2nd argument in makemarker for argument consistency (usually a dropdown option comes before all the other args, and this kind of consistency is important for editing mlog code as text).

title: Make file name orders deterministic
bodyText:
If your pull request is not translation or serverlist-related, read the list of requirements below and check each box:

 I have read the contribution guidelines.
 I have ensured that my code compiles, if applicable.
 I have ensured that any new features in this PR function correctly in-game, if applicable.


I was going through some java packages on Nixpkgs to see if they were completely deterministic, and if not, fix them.
This package only had a few issues with determinism: one of them I could figure out, and is fixed in this PR, the other one is probably any issue inside Arc.

The first issue was that file.list() or file.listFiles() gives back files in a non-fixed order (at least on Linux), so the generated files would differ between builds.
This PR fixes this by running .sort() before processing the file names.
I also refactored the code to use list instead of listFiles.

The other issue mentioned above is an issue, where the spritesheets inside core/assets/sprites are in a (maybe) random order.
link to the relevant code
Sadly, as I am not really familiar with the codebase of Arc I couldn't figure out whether the issue was with the file iteration of the used FileProcessor or the packing algorithm
Should I open this last part as an issue on Arc?

title: Truncate ping response packets
bodyText:
Previously all ping response packets were 0-padded to 500 bytes. By truncating we only send the bytes that are actually needed.

title: Shader getShaderFi check for mod files
bodyText:
If the initial Core.files.internal doesn't find a file, try finding with tree.get.
Use tree.get instead of file.internal in getShaderFi. Makes custom shaders with js/java slightly less annoying as modders wouldn't need to make their own version of LoadShader just to load their shader files and reduces copy/paste for things like surface shaders, as a copy of the SurfaceShader that extends off the copied version of LoadShader wouldn't be needed anymore, and also allows mods with a frag with an identical name to override vanilla shaders.

title: Allow categorized sprite names to not be prefixed.
bodyText:
Many of the sprite generations have (arguably cursed) category prefixes, such as block- (e.g. block-contentname-full, unit-contentname-ui). This completely breaks in mods however, especially ones with pre-generated sprites as the region name will be something like modname-block-modname-contentname-full.
This PR makes it so that if the game detects that the file name is prefixed with exactly one word, followed by a hyphen and the mod's internal name and another hyphen, it will not be prefixed.

title: Make a "unitCommandPosition" event so that unit commands issued to non-attack coordinates can still be listened for
bodyText:
I tested this; it doesn't interfere with anything else that I'm aware of (although how would it?) but I checked to make sure anyway. It compiles and runs fine.
Basically, what this does is add a single event, which is fired when the player commands a selected group of units to coordinates and isn't attacking. Currently, there does exist a Trigger.unitCommandAttack, which is fired when the player gives units an attack command (i.e. there's an an enemy building at the coordinates, or the user clicked on an enemy unit instead of terrain when giving the command). There is also Trigger.unitCommandChange, which is fired whenever the user changes their command group (i.e. draws a new selection box, or selects all by type), but
Trigger.unitCommandPosition (the new event) makes it possible to make listeners for whenever a movement command is issued to a group of units.

title: Custom rules dialog enhancement, small fixes
bodyText:
Fixed wrong (old) info about format placeholders in all unfinished locales (it was saying to use @ instead of {0} for logic format instruction) (that's why so many files are changed in this PR)
Added rule search in custom map rules dialog
Added info buttons for some rules (basically a must have thing for mods adding new rules, but even some vanilla rules should have a better explanation than just a title)

More complicated stuff: rules in separate "categories" (previously they were simply divided by accent color titles) now belong to different tables. This way, titles only appear when there's at least one rule in category during search.
Also, the basic methods for adding new rules are now public (hope it is fine), and setup() runs all the stuff in Seq<Runnable> additionalSetup before adding category tables to dialog. Combined with having separate category tables for rules, these changes make adding new rules through modding way easier.
